label: Exa API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Exa.ai Search API.

tools.name: CancelEnrichmentProcess
tools.description:
Cancel a running enrichment process.

Use this tool to cancel any currently running enrichment process. Once canceled, the process cannot be resumed.

parameters.name: enrichment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the enrichment process to be canceled.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset to identify which enrichment process to cancel.

tools.name: CancelRunningSearch
tools.description:
Cancels a currently running search operation.

This tool cancels an ongoing search by using the specified webset and search ID. Useful when you need to stop a search that is still in progress.

parameters.name: search_id
parameters.description: The ID of the search to cancel. Provide the unique string identifier for the targeted search operation.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Webset where the search is executing. Use this to specify the Webset to be canceled.

tools.name: CancelWebsetOperations
tools.description:
Cancel all operations on a specified Webset.

Use this tool to stop any ongoing enrichment or search processes on a Webset, marking it as 'idle'.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset to cancel operations on.

tools.name: CreateDataImport
tools.description:
Create a new import for data upload and enhancement.

Use this tool to initialize a new import process to upload data into Websets. This import can then be used to enrich, search, or exclude data using Websets' features. It provides an upload URL and a deadline for uploading the data.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: CreateMonitorForWebsets
tools.description:
Automatically create and schedule a monitor for Websets.

This tool creates a new Monitor to keep Websets updated with fresh data. It automatically executes search and refresh operations based on defined schedules to ensure the content is current. You can configure cron expressions and timezones for precise control.

tools.name: CreateResearchRequest
tools.description:
Create a new research request through Exa API.

This tool initiates a new research request by calling the specified endpoint of the Exa API. It should be used when there is a need to start or submit a new research inquiry.

tools.name: CreateWebhookForNotifications
tools.description:
Create webhooks for event notifications from Exa.

Use this tool to set up webhooks that notify you of specific events in your Websets. Choose event types and specify the URL to receive notifications. Begins receiving notifications instantly and provides a secret key for signature verification.

tools.name: CreateWebset
tools.description:
Create a new Webset with optional configurations.

This tool allows you to create a new Webset with optional search, import, and enrichment configurations. Specify an `externalId` for easier integration. The Webset begins processing automatically upon creation.

tools.name: CreateWebsetEnrichment
tools.description:
Create an enrichment for a specified webset.

This tool is used to create an enrichment for a specified webset. It's suitable for when you need to enhance a webset with additional data.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the webset for which the enrichment is to be created.

tools.name: CreateWebsetSearch
tools.description:
Create a new search for a specified webset.

This tool is used to create a new search within a specified webset, reusing previous search results and evaluating them against new criteria. Useful for updating or refining search parameters.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Webset to create a search within.

tools.name: DeleteEnrichment
tools.description:
Delete an enrichment and cancel running processes.

Use this tool to delete an enrichment, cancel any running processes, and remove all generated enrichment results.

parameters.name: enrichment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the enrichment to be deleted.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset to identify which enrichment to delete.

tools.name: DeleteImport
tools.description:
Delete an import by its ID.

Use this tool to delete an import record when you have the import ID.

parameters.name: import_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the import to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteMonitor
tools.description:
Deletes a specified monitor using its ID.

Use this tool to delete a monitor by providing its ID. It should be called when you need to remove a monitor from the system.

parameters.name: monitor_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the monitor to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteWebset
tools.description:
Deletes a Webset and its associated items.

Use this tool to permanently delete a Webset and all its associated items. Once deleted, it cannot be recovered.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier or external ID of the Webset to delete.

tools.name: DeleteWebsetItem
tools.description:
Delete an item from a webset and cancel its enrichment process.

Use this tool to remove an item from the specified webset. This will also cancel any ongoing enrichment process associated with the item.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset from which the item will be deleted.

parameters.name: webset_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the item to be deleted from the webset.

tools.name: FindSimilarLinks
tools.description:
Find similar links to a given link.

This tool finds links similar to the provided link and can optionally retrieve their contents. It should be called when a user needs to discover related web pages or resources.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GenerateAnswerSummary
tools.description:
Retrieve direct answers or detailed summaries with citations.

Use this tool to perform a search based on a query. It generates either a direct answer or a detailed summary with citations, depending on the nature of the query.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The question or query to be answered or summarized.

parameters.name: enable_streaming_response
parameters.description: Return the response as a server-sent events (SSE) stream if set to true.

parameters.name: include_full_text
parameters.description: If true, the response includes full text content in the search results.

search_query.value: What are the health benefits of green tea?

tools.name: GetContentDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details about specific content.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about specific content from the EXA service. It should be called when content details are needed for further processing or display.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GetEnrichmentDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific enrichment.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific enrichment in a webset by providing the webset and enrichment IDs.

parameters.name: enrichment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific enrichment you want to retrieve within the webset.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the webset to retrieve enrichment details for.

tools.name: GetEventById
tools.description:
Retrieve details of an event using its ID.

Use this tool to obtain information about a specific event by providing its unique identifier.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the event to retrieve details for.

tools.name: GetResearchById
tools.description:
Retrieve research information using a specific ID.

Use this tool to obtain detailed research information by providing a specific research ID. Supports real-time updates with streaming.

parameters.name: enable_streaming
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to receive real-time streaming updates of the research information.

parameters.name: event_filter
parameters.description: Specify the events to filter for in the research retrieval. Accepts a comma-separated list of event types.

parameters.name: research_id
parameters.description: A string representing the unique identifier of the research to be retrieved.

tools.name: GetSearchById
tools.description:
Retrieve a search by its ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific search by providing its ID.

parameters.name: search_id
parameters.description: The ID of the search to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Webset to retrieve the specific search.

tools.name: GetSpecificImport
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific import.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a particular import by providing its ID.

parameters.name: import_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific import to retrieve details about.

tools.name: GetSpecificMonitor
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific monitor using its ID.

This tool is used to obtain information about a particular monitor by providing its unique ID. Call this tool when you need to get specific details about a monitor.

parameters.name: monitor_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the monitor to retrieve details for.

tools.name: GetSpecificMonitorRun
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific monitor run.

This tool retrieves details of a specific monitor run by using the monitor ID and run ID. It should be called when you need to access information about a particular monitor run.

parameters.name: monitor_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the monitor to retrieve the run for.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the specific run to retrieve details for.

tools.name: GetWebhookInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a webhook using its ID.

This tool is used to get details about a specific webhook by providing its ID. It should be called when you need to access information about a particular webhook. The secret associated with the webhook is not included for security reasons.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the webhook you want details about.

tools.name: GetWebhooksList
tools.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all webhooks in your account.

Use this tool to get all the webhooks associated with your account, with options to paginate through results using limit and cursor parameters.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor used to navigate through pages of results for webhooks.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of webhooks to return per page, up to a maximum of 200.

tools.name: GetWebsetDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific webset.

This tool is used to obtain the details of a specific webset using its unique identifier. Call this when you need information related to a particular webset.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier or external ID for the Webset to retrieve.

parameters.name: resources_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of resources to include in the response for additional details.

tools.name: GetWebsetItem
tools.description:
Retrieve a specific Webset Item by ID.

This tool is used to retrieve information about a specific Webset Item using its ID. It should be called when you need detailed information about a particular item associated with a Webset.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset to identify the desired Webset from which the item is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: webset_item_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Webset item to retrieve.

tools.name: ListImports
tools.description:
Retrieve all import entries for the Webset.

Use this tool to get a comprehensive list of all imports associated with the Webset, useful for tracking or auditing purposes.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: String used for paginating through results. Pass it to retrieve the next set of results.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of import results to return.

tools.name: ListMonitorRuns
tools.description:
Lists all runs for a given monitor.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of all runs associated with a specific monitor. It's helpful for tracking and analyzing past monitor activities.

parameters.name: monitor_id
parameters.description: The ID of the monitor to list all associated runs.

tools.name: ListResearchRequests
tools.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of research requests.

Use this tool to obtain a paginated list of all research requests. Ideal for reviewing or analyzing current research queries.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string representing the position in the paginated results to continue retrieving data from.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of research requests to return in the response. Helps manage pagination effectively.

tools.name: ListSystemEvents
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all system events.

Call this tool to get a detailed list of events that have occurred within the system. Useful for auditing, monitoring, or reviewing activities. Supports pagination through a cursor parameter.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Filter events created after or at this timestamp. Use a valid ISO 8601 datetime string in UTC.

parameters.name: event_types_filter
parameters.description: Filter events by specifying an array of event type names.

parameters.name: filter_created_before
parameters.description: Filter events created before or at this timestamp (inclusive). Provide a valid ISO 8601 datetime string in UTC.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for paginating through event results. Use it to navigate through pages of events.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of event results to return. This controls the size of the result set for a single request.

tools.name: ListWebhookAttempts
tools.description:
Retrieve and list all webhook attempt records.

This tool retrieves all attempts made by a specific webhook, ordered in descending order. It is useful for monitoring webhook activity and diagnosing issues.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the webhook to retrieve attempt records for.

parameters.name: event_type_filter
parameters.description: Filter webhook attempts by specifying the type of event, such as 'webset.created' or 'monitor.run.completed'.

parameters.name: filter_by_successful_attempts
parameters.description: Use 'true' to filter for successful webhook attempts and 'false' for unsuccessful ones.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string used to paginate through the webhook attempt results.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of webhook attempt records to return.

tools.name: ListWebsetItems
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of items from a specific webset.

This tool fetches items from a designated webset, allowing pagination with the 'cursor' parameter if needed.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or external ID of the Webset to retrieve items from.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string used to paginate through the results. Pass this to retrieve the next set of items in the webset.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return. This controls the size of the page in a paginated response.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the source from which to retrieve items.

tools.name: ListWebsets
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of available websets.

Use this tool to obtain a list of websets. You can paginate through results using a cursor.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string used to paginate through the list of Websets.

parameters.name: websets_return_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of Websets to return in the response.

tools.name: ListWebsiteMonitors
tools.description:
Fetch all monitors associated with a website.

Use this tool to retrieve a comprehensive list of all monitoring services set up for a specific website. This is helpful for maintenance, auditing, or upgrading processes.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor for paginating through the monitor results.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of monitor results to return. Use for pagination.

parameters.name: webset_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Webset to retrieve monitors for. This is required to specify which website's monitors you want to list.

tools.name: PerformSearch
tools.description:
Perform a search and retrieve relevant results.

Use this tool to execute a search with a prompt-engineered query via Exa and obtain relevant results. Optionally, retrieve the contents of the results.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: PreviewSearchQueryAnalysis
tools.description:
Preview how a search query will be decomposed into a webset.

Use this tool to preview the decomposition and analysis of a search query before committing to webset creation, helping users understand the detected entity type, generated search criteria, and available enrichment options.

tools.name: RemoveWebhook
tools.description:
Remove a webhook from your account.

Use this tool to delete a webhook. Once deleted, it stops receiving notifications immediately and cannot be restored. You'll need to create a new webhook if you wish to reinstate it. Use when you need to stop a webhook permanently.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook to remove. This is necessary for specifying which webhook to delete.

tools.name: UpdateImportConfiguration
tools.description:
Update an import configuration with specified parameters.

Call this tool to modify the settings of an existing import configuration using its ID.

parameters.name: import_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the import configuration to update.

tools.name: UpdateMonitorConfiguration
tools.description:
Update a monitor configuration in Exa.

Use this tool to update the configuration of a specified monitor in the Exa system. This is useful for modifying settings such as thresholds, alerts, and other configurations.

parameters.name: monitor_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the monitor to update.

tools.name: UpdateWebhookSettings
tools.description:
Update webhook settings such as events, URL, or metadata.

This tool lets you modify a webhook's configuration instantly. Use it to add or remove event notifications, update the notification URL, or change metadata. The current status of the webhook remains unchanged during updates.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the webhook to update.

tools.name: UpdateWebsetEnrichment
tools.description:
Update an enrichment configuration for a webset.

Use this tool to modify the existing enrichment configuration of a specified webset. Call this tool when you need to apply new settings or changes to an enrichment setup.

parameters.name: enrichment_configuration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the enrichment configuration to be updated.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the webset to update. This is required to target the correct webset for enrichment modification.

tools.name: UpdateWebsetExa
tools.description:
Update an existing webset on Exa platform.

Use this tool to update the details of an existing webset on the Exa platform. Invoke it when modifications to a webset are needed, such as changing its properties or configurations.

parameters.name: webset_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier (id or externalId) of the Webset to update.

summary:
ExaApi provides a toolkit that enables LLMs to interact directly with the Exa.ai Search API, facilitating advanced data handling and search operations. 

**Capabilities**  
- Create, update, and delete various components such as Websets and enrichments.  
- Execute and manage search processes with options to cancel ongoing operations.  
- Set up automatic monitoring and notifications to keep data current.  
- Retrieve detailed information about websets, enrichments, and research requests.  
- Perform direct searches and fetch relevant content or summaries.

**Secrets**  
- API key: EXA_API_KEY, used for authentication and API access.
